answers.answer: Another question... What are your thoughts on the testing for Lyme disease?  I have read that the normal testing isn't that accurate.  Have you heard of the IGENEX lab in California?  What are your thoughts on that?  I will let you know how my appt goes on Thursday.  Thank you, again.Sincerely, Jen

Hi.It is rare for an EMG to show some significant findings when there are no symptoms, especially the numbness. The weakness criterion is not essential, as it could be a sensory neuropathy only.As far as the Lyme testing is concerned, I think the routine testing is sensitive but not specific enough. I can't comment upon the IGENEX lab as I do not have any information. But I guess you can have a discussion with your new neurologist about the lab and a possible retesting for Lyme if he feels necessary.You can make a mention of EMG / NCS to him on Thursday.Regards

question: Well, this coming Thursday is my appt with the new neuro.  Lets say for instance that she does do the EMG/NCS and the results are normal, saying that I do not have a form of peripheral neuropathy, then what?  Does an EMG ever show anything when the patient doesn't have numbness or weakness?  I'm starting to get a little scared, because I have been tested for so many things, and if it does turn out to be PN, then why do I have it?  I have been tested for Lyme, diabetes, thyroid, metabolic disorders, lupus, etc....  HELP!!Thank you, Jen
